channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13865] Increase the default value for hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multipler from 2 to 4 (part 2)
item.description: Its 4 in the book and 2 in a current master.
item.summary: Increase the default value for hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multipler from 2 to 4 (part 2)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Its should be fixed either in the book or in the code.

HBASE-11209 increased hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier from 2 to 4

I will submit a patch to change the two code instances.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12738473/HBASE-13865.1.patch
against master branch at commit c19bc6d6e0dee4b60f45350ab7561fd15cfead7d.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12738473

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestRegionRebalancing

-1 core zombie tests. There are 3 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.encoding.TestChangingEncoding.testCrazyRandomChanges(TestChangingEncoding.java:248)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.wal.TestWALSplit.testSplit(TestWALSplit.java:663)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitListener.testFinished(ResourceCheckerJUnitListener.java:183)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14339//testReport/

Does this address your original filing Vladimir Rodionov ? I don't think it does?
It does, but I would move default (4) to HConstants.
I created the HConstants variables.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14357//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14357//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14357//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14357//console

This message is automatically generated.
Nick Dimiduk Could you please review? Thanks
stack Would some updates be need before this can be considered for committing? Thanks

--- a/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java

+++ b/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java

@@ -744,7 +744,8 @@ public class HRegion implements HeapSize, PropagatingConfigurationObserver, Regi

     }

     this.memstoreFlushSize = flushSize;

     this.blockingMemStoreSize = this.memstoreFlushSize *

-        conf.getLong("hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier", 2);

+        conf.getLong(HConstants.HREGION_MEMSTORE_BLOCK_MULTIPLIER,

+                HConstants.DEFAULT_HREGION_MEMSTORE_BLOCK_MULTIPLIER);

   }

 

   /**

It looks like HBASE-11209 didn't get everywhere, or this change to HRegion was intentionally omitted.

Assuming that's a bug, +1.
Reattaching patch.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12748770/HBASE-13865.2.patch
against master branch at commit 5f6632f80159f283125a7a826d5f8ef76dbe1caa.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12748770

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 16 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14979//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14979//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14979//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14979//console

This message is automatically generated.
Invoking here the spirit of Nicolas Liochon for review.

Hey Nick

If I'm not mistaken (I'm always confused by the various config files...), the patch should not change the behavior for most common deployments, because the value is set to 4 in the hbase-default.xml (and for the users who set it to 2: the xml config is used first, it won't change for them as well).

So:

  • The patch is a good cleanup imho
  • It's safe as it does not change the behavior.

+1

I updated the release notes.

Pushed to branches 0.98+. Thanks for the patch Gabor Liptak.

FYI Andrew Purtell, Enis Soztutar, Sean Busbey.

Closing this issue after 1.0.2 release.

please don't close issues that haven't been released in all marked fix versions (please mark the 'resovled' instead). This currently claims to be in the 1.2.1 release, while it will actually be in the 1.2.0.
(yay! admins can edit fix versions on closed issues. nevermind. )

please don't close issues that haven't been released in all marked fix versions (please mark the 'resovled' instead). This currently claims to be in the 1.2.1 release, while it will actually be in the 1.2.0.

We do bulk close of issues with fixVersions after a release. It would be hard to manually check the issues for this.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Increase default hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier from 2 to 4 in the code to match the default value in the config files.
